subject: Re: Music vs no music- a short experiment in evp-exalted carrier
author: kenneth b thomas
full_text:
you guys all stay up later than i do.

i tried an old carbon granule element from 1950s era telephone and it 
sure makes a good white noise source when dc biased.  plugged it into 
analog recorder .  also functions as low gain parametric amp ala 
nathan stubblefield.  since this is almost morning for me i guess i 
will set up speaker-mic recorder now.

impedance mismatch for backward audio transformer was not too bad for 
lower voice frequencies.  giving serious thought to using auto 
ignition coil as earth-to-beyond input impedance matcher.

tried it before but everybody complained voices sounded like CB radio 
voices.





-- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, " RetroCom" <vfp19968@...> wrote:
>
> I have experimented with music and a series of filters in a closed 
system. I will post an example that first plays the source and then 
the filtered result which contains a message. The message I hear 
is "The filters on, give us some babbling" They prefer babble over 
music but I find them much easier to pick out in an all music passage.
> 
> Dave
> 
> --- kennnthomas2000@... wrote:
> 
> From: "kenneth b thomas" <kennnthomas2000@...>
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Music vs no music- a short experiment in evp-
exalted carrier
> Date: Sat, 24 Mar 2007 22:52:23 -0000
> 
> music is as far away from white noise as you can get.
> 
> 
> there are no voice fragments for entities to manipulate
> 
> voice voltage is being added to voltage of music which acts as 
> carrier, via some inductor or nonlinear element near input.
> 
> 
> audio transformer turned backwards connected to input with large 
> speaker on8 ohm side and put at bottom of sound confining container 
> like plastic garbage can  would eliminate hit-or-miss voltage 
> superposition.
> 
> 
> use a speaker for the microphone at bottom of wastebasket  hook to 
> low side of audio transformer.  voices could be about 20 times 
louder
> 
> 
> going to try it myself asap..speaker as microphone
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@> wrote:
> >
> > I know they like to use music. In particular they can make use of 
> certain instruments to propel thier voice across. So last night I 
> played a short clip of Joe Satriani's "always with you always with 
> me" it contains music only, no vocals. I discovered that in the 
first 
> few seconds of the clip the voices were able to sustain a loud, 
> comprehensive line of communication until Satriani kicked it into 
> high gear and the guitar notes were too loud and drowned everything 
> out. Some could be heard on regular playback, most could be heard 
> clearer at a slowed down rate of -74% & -30%. I then did a session 
> with no music. Both sessions lasted under 1 minute and both 
sessions 
> had a yeild of about 18 clips/sentences. The difference being that 
> more of the music clips were louder and clearer to understand for 
me 
> and hopefully for you too. 
> >    
> >   Heres a few of the evp clips for you to download and evaluate. 
> Many are very loud so I recommend you lower the sound DOWN... ALOT 
> til you play it once to see what volume level it has. I use stereo 
> speakers so I am used to blasting my head off LOL so careful you 
dont 
> blow a speaker or your eardrums. Even I usually turn them down 
> because the level of vibration and noise may be too much for my 
dogs 
> ears. The process I used was the same, p1 filter only, amped at +15 
> which works differently depending on what comes across and what I 
> used for background sound. When using music the noise level is 
> definitely alot higher and you will need to lower your sound for 
> those LOL
> >    
> >   Only sharing some of the ones I think others can hear. The 
music 
> session had alot more than the nonmusic session. I will send a 
short 
> clip of satriani (the first part where the voices were the best) so 
> that if anyone wants to give it a try they can.
> >    
> >   Misty
> >    
> >    
> > 
> >  
> > ---------------------------------
> > Check out the all-new Yahoo! Mail beta - Fire up a more powerful 
> email and get things done faster.
> >
>
